title: Offset printers in Portland?
content:
Hi everyone,  
I just moved to Portland so I don't know much about the city.

I'm here to ask if you guys know any specialty offset printer in Portland that is able to print posters on archival quality paper?

So far I have:  
 [http://www.pinballpublishing.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20100131103327/http:/www.pinballpublishing.com/ "http://www.pinballpublishing.com")

and

[http://www.stumptownprinters.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20100131103327/http:/www.stumptownprinters.com/ "http://www.stumptownprinters.com")

However, these two shops offer 1-color offset printing. I'm looking into something like 4 to 6 color offset printing for a limited edition poster I have in mind (500 copies).

I would love to have a local printer here so that I can go there and get my hands on production as well as giving them insight on my specific needs.

Thank you very much!

Oh, and I would love to get together with fellow typophiles in order to get to know a little more the city and the people.
author: Saddlestich

comments.content: Pinball goes far beyond 1-color. They do outstanding work with great attention to detail. I have a run of 3-color posters coming off the press this week. I can't recommend them enough. Just stop by, call or email and they'll give you the lowdown on what they can do for you.

I know you spec'd offset...but if you think it's screenable, check out Seizure Palace as well. Poster fiends over there. [http://seizurepalace.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20100131103327/http:/seizurepalace.com/ "http://seizurepalace.com/")
